Transcript: Lucy: It was very nice to meet you. Thank you so much. Don, you made it!
Don: Yeah.
Lucy: Terrific. Hey, everybody, dinner is served. Voila! Thanks.
Colleen: Lucy, you're a lifesaver.

Lucy: No, you guys are the lifesavers, helping all these people with the 
train wreck. Go ahead. Hey, you, if you're hungry, please, everybody -- there's 
plenty for everybody. Help yourselves.

Deneice: If I don't get some of this quick, somebody's going to be treating 
me.
Lucy: Well, eat, eat. Hey, has anybody seen Kevin?
Nurse: In there.
Lucy: Oh. Thanks.
Kevin: Hey.
Lucy: Oh, hey.
Kevin: I thought I heard your voice out here.
Lucy: I am so glad you're still here. I didn't think you were.
Kevin: Well, I was just finishing up counseling some of the victims.

Lucy: Oh, you look so tired and hungry. Hey, how about a nice, big, fat slice 
of broccoli and anchovy pizza? Oh! Oh, no. Not -- not -- oh! Not again.
Kevin: Well, I guess it wouldn't be the Nurses Ball without it.
Lucy: Oh, but, Doc, isn't that a tradition we could sort of let die a death?
Kevin: I, for one, am glad to see some traditions never die.
Lucy: Oh, I just want a Nurses Ball that goes off without a hitch.
Kevin: Lucy, you did a great job. The night was a huge success.

Lucy: It was, wasn't it? It was so much fun. We raised oodles and oodles of 
money, Serena's safe, and you're here with me. I have you. I'm so lucky I have 
you.
Kevin: You don't have a whole dress.
Lucy: Well, could you hold it?
Kevin: Yeah.

Joe: Whoa, whoa. I thought we were going to rent a suite somewhere -- you 
know, caviar, champagne? Celebrate my HIV test coming back negative?
Gabriela: I thought that's what we were doing.
Joe: Well, how about we do it in style?
Gabriela: All I need is a flat surface.
Joe: Uh-huh.
Gabriela: Or not. Come here.
Joe: I never knew you were a -- you had so much talent.
Gabriela: You haven't seen the half of it yet.

Joe: Well, as long as I'm the only one who does. You know, your little 
routine at the Nurses Ball was --
Gabriela: I did good, didn't I?
Joe: Yeah.
Gabriela: Yeah.
Joe: Yeah, it was just -- just a little over the top.
Gabriela: What, are you nervous because your mom was there?
Joe: I've just never seen you so uninhibited before.
Gabriela: Oh, maybe you should take a closer look.
Alison: Oh. Talk about a night of disasters.
Jamal: I didn't think our routine was that bad.

Alison: Well, I'm just glad that it's over -- train wrecks, floods. What else 
could happen?
Livvie: I wonder how Jack's doing.
Jamal: Oh, he must have felt pretty bad to cut out early like that.

Livvie: Yeah, he said he was going to come back and get some sleep. I'm going 
to go check on him.
Alison: So.
Jamal: So.
Alison: Big night tonight, huh?

Jamal: Oh. Yeah, they must've made a killing. Did you see how much those 
Yankee boxes went for in the silent auction?
Alison: Yeah -- no, that's not what I'm talking about.
Jamal: Oh, the walk-on role for "All My Children?" Yeah, I know.
Alison: You really don't know what today is, do you?
Jamal: Well, something tells me the answer's not "Friday."
Alison: No. Forget it. Forget it.
Jamal: Ok.
Alison: Jamal, you really don't remember, do you?
Jamal: What?
Alison: Well, a year ago tonight was our first date at the Nurses Ball.
Jamal: Oh, yeah.
Alison: Yeah.
Jamal: It has been a whole year, hasn't it?
Alison: Yeah, sure has.
Jamal: Yeah. We should've -- should've celebrated or something.
Alison: I know, or something.
Jamal: Something.
Alison: That's ok.
Jamal: So, I guess you probably wouldn't be interested in this, huh?
Alison: What is that?

Jamal: Oh, nothing. I mean, you're right. I mean, our one-year anniversary is 
probably no big deal --
Alison: Come on, come on!
Jamal: No, no, no.
Alison: Please, please! Please, don't toy with me.
Alison: Oh. These are beautiful. You shouldn't have done this.
Jamal: Oh, yeah, right!
Alison: No, I'm serious. We're, like, trying to save money and stuff.
Jamal: And? It was important to me.
Alison: Oh. I love them. I love you.
Jamal: Happy anniversary, Spunky.
Alison: Thank you.
Livvie: Jack's not in his room.
Alison: Well, maybe he just went out to get some air.
Jamal: Yeah. I'll go look.
Alison: Yeah, yeah. I'll come with you.
Livvie: Me, too.
Jamal: Well, somebody's got to stay here just in case Jack comes back.
Alison: Yeah, I think it should be Livvie.
Livvie: But I --

Alison: No, no -- we'll find him and we'll bring him back, I promise. We'll 
be right back.
Sam: Well, look who we found. Heard you were back from the dead, Jack.
Jack: Sorry, Sam.
Sam: I saw you. You didn't move, you weren't breathing.
Jack: Yeah. Yeah. Zach -- Zach didn't finish the job.
Sam: Well, we're going to finish it for him.
Jack: No. You don't want to do that.
Sam: First you toss our diamonds, then you smoke Zach.
Jack: Look, I didn't kill Zach, Sam.
Sam: Yes, you did. And now you're going to stay dead.
Lucy: Mmm.
Kevin: Feeling that good, huh?
Lucy: How can I not be? I mean, come on, we raised a lot of money.
Kevin: Mm-hmm.

Lucy: Serena's safe and sound. I'm with you. I don't want to think about that 
Nurses Ball for at least another year.
Kevin: Oh, at least a couple weeks.
Lucy: Ok. I give it a month.
Kevin: A month?
Lucy: Moratorium.
Kevin: A -- oh, lord, be praised.
Lucy: No, I want to concentrate all that time on you.
Kevin: Hmm?
Lucy: Hmm.
Nurse: Dr. Collins?
Kevin: Yes?

Nurse: I'm sorry to interrupt, but we need you in three. The lady's pretty 
shook up after the train wreck.
Kevin: Ok.
Lucy: Go, go. I'll wait.
Kevin: You're sure? I don't know how long this will be.

Lucy: It's ok. I've got my pizza, and I'm just going to sit here and clear my 
brain of all thoughts but you.
Kevin: I'll see you later.
Lucy: Go.
Alison: Hey, Deneice. Have you or Colleen seen Jack Ramsey tonight?
Colleen: No. Haven't seen him.
Deneice: Nope, no Jack Ramsey.
Alison: Ok.
Lucy: Alison. Hi.
Alison: Lucy, hi.
Lucy: So, is everything all right, I hope?
Alison: Yeah, everything's fine. Why?
Lucy: Well, what are you doing here in the E.R. looking for Jack?

Alison: Oh. Oh, well, he had to leave early from the Nurses Ball. You know, 
he said he wasn't really feeling that great, so I thought maybe it was just, 
like, indigestion.
Lucy: Uh, no. I don't think so. My choice of food was impeccable.

Alison: Yeah. Well, it must've just been a bug or something. He probably just 
went back to his room.
Lucy: Yeah, yeah. Where's Livvie?
Alison: Well, with him, I'm sure.
Lucy: Are you really sure?

Alison: Yes. Lucy, I just saw her a little bit ago. She's fine, I'm sure. 
There's nothing to worry about.

Lucy: Fine, but -- you know, I'm not trying to pry. I'm not really a 
busybody, you know. It's just that Livvie is Doc's daughter, which practically 
makes her my stepdaughter. And Jack is dating Livvie, which makes Jack -- well, 
we're sort of related somehow.

Alison: Yeah, ok. Lucy, everybody's fine. Jack's fine, Livvie's fine, I'm 
fine. Everything's fine.
Lucy: Fine.
Alison: Fine.
Lucy: Fine.
Alison: Ok.
Lucy: Ok. Ta.
Sam: He's all yours.
Jack: Come on, Sam. I didn't kill Zach. It wasn't me. You're messing with --
Livvie: If they think I'm just going to stay here and do nothing --
Caleb: It's just me, Olivia.
Livvie: No, why do you keep following me?
Caleb: I told you before. I'm your future.

Livvie: I don't know what you think I am to you, but I know who my future is,

Caleb: Look at me. You know you want to. Yeah.
Livvie: But I'm in love with Jack.

Caleb: Then why don't you leave? You can't. Because you know I'm right. You

Joe: No, wait. Wait, Gabby.
Joe: You been working out, or what?
Gabriela: There's only one workout I'm interested in.
Joe: Wait -- Gabby --

Caleb: You are so beautiful. Your skin, so soft, eyes, so warm. Hey. I don't 
want to see more tears in them. There's been too many lately.
Livvie: Not now, now that Jack's back.

Caleb: Is he? You lie awake at night wondering, feeling he doesn't seem quite 
right. Not the man you fell in love with.
Livvie: How could you --
Caleb: I know a lot about you, Olivia.
Livvie: Jack's had a terrible accident. He's been through a lot.

Caleb: Hmm. But you were already thinking that before. You thought he had 
changed.
Livvie: No.
Caleb: Don't try to deny it. I know.
Livvie: No, I -- I told you, I'm in love with Jack.

Caleb: No. He doesn't deserve you. You deserve the world. You should come see 
my world, a place where your every desire will be fulfilled beyond anything you 
could imagine.

Caleb: You want that, don't you? Then come with me. You're not afraid of me. 
You know that.
Livvie: Yeah.
Man: Come on, get up. Oh!
Jamal: Hey, Jack, Jack. Chill, man, chill. Whoa!
Joe: You got a little rough there.
Gabriela: You liked it, didn't you?
Joe: I'm going to have to start working out if I'm going to keep up with you.
Gabriela: Ok.

Joe: Hey, hey, hey. Hold on a second, Gabby. I need a little breather. Look, 
what -- what's gotten into you? I mean, it's like you're --
Gabriela: Superhuman?
Joe: Yeah. Where'd this come from?
Gabriela: There's lots more.

Joe: And we'll have plenty of time for it, all right? Now that we know that 
we have a future together. Oh, the people from Bounds Corners called this 
afternoon. They're sending our tickets next week.
Gabriela: No.

Joe: Look -- look, I know -- I know it's short notice, but they need someone 
at the clinic right away.
Gabriela: I can't.

Joe: Well, maybe I should go first, I mean, if you need more time to get 
things together here.
Gabriela: I'm not going.
Joe: What?
Gabriela: I'm not going with you, Joe.
Joe: Ok, all right. All right, you got me. Just for a second, though.
Gabriela: I'm not kidding.
Joe: Gabby, what's going on? I thought we were doing this thing together.
Gabriela: Well, you shouldn't have. I can't leave here.
Lucy: Oh, Doc, hi.
Kevin: Yeah, just me.
Lucy: Hey, pull up a gurney.
Kevin: Ok.

Lucy: I was having the most -- ooh, the most incredible dream. You and me and 
Serena, we were in the park, and we were laughing and we were so -- so happy.
Kevin: That's not a dream, Lucy.
Lucy: But it is to me, especially after last year.
Kevin: Oh, don't do that to yourself, not now.

Lucy: No, it's ok. I can do it now. That's just the point. Doc, when I lost 
Christina, you know, I thought the world had come to an end. I thought I just 
never wanted to wake up. I thought all the light had gone out of the world, and 
I just wanted to be alone forever. But you're back, and I'm happy again.

Kevin: You know, Lucy, no one ever thinks they'll be happy again when tragedy 
hits.

Lucy: I wish I could tell them they would be, though. It's going to get 
better. I mean, you always carry a piece of that tragedy with you, and I always 
will, but it gets good. It's good again.

Kevin: Yeah, it is good -- for both of us. And I hit bottom, too, Lucy. If it 
hadn't been for you and Livvie, I don't know --
Lucy: Oh, Livvie. Oh, Livvie, Livvie -- have you heard from her?
Kevin: No. Should I?
Lucy: Well, you know, it's kind of strange.
Kevin: Strange? How?
Lucy: Well, Alison came to the ER looking for Jack.
Kevin: Looking for Jack here?
Lucy: Yeah, because he wasn't feeling very well.
Kevin: Not well enough to be at the ER?

Lucy: See, this is my point. I asked Alison, and she sort of made this excuse 
about, "Oh, Livvie's probably with Jack back at Jack's place." Oh -- oh, gosh, 
and I've been meaning to tell you this. There's also another teeny, tiny, little 
weird thing that's going on.
Kevin: How teeny?
Lucy: Well, this.
Kevin: Lucy, that's a bullet. What are you doing with that?

Lucy: Yeah, I know. Remember at the river, that altercation with the kids and 
the police when we were there?
Kevin: Yeah. What about it?

Lucy: Remember when Jack jumped in front of that bullet meant for Jamal that 
the police fired, and the police thought he hit him, but somehow he missed Jack?
Kevin: Yeah, not something I'll forget soon.
Lucy: I found this, Doc, on the ground there.
Kevin: Let me see that.
Lucy: Look, doesn't it -- it looks like it hit something, right?
Kevin: Maybe a tree.

Lucy: But it was empty. It was open space, kind of, you know? I think maybe 
-- just maybe it hit Jack, and that's why he's acting so strange.

Kevin: Lucy, if it did, he wouldn't even be walking. No human in the world is 
strong enough for that. But you're right, though. It definitely hit something.
Lucy: Ok, then. If it didn't hit Jack, then what?
Kevin: I don't know. But there is something strange going on.

Jamal: Jack. Jack, you're going to kill him! Jack, what are you doing? Jack, 
Jack, Jack --
Jack: What's -- what's going on?

Jamal: Dude, you're bugging out like you did yesterday with your brother, 
bro.
[Jack moans]
Jamal: What's wrong?
Jack: Something's not right, Jamal. What's happening to me?
Alison: Jamal?

Alison: I am so glad I found you. Oh, my God. What is going on? What 
happened?
Jamal: Let's go.
Alison: Jamal, did you do this?
Jamal: No, Jack did. Stay away from him. Just keep clear.
Livvie: Where are we?
Caleb: Welcome home, Olivia.
>> On the next "Port Charles" --
Gabriela: I'm sorry, Joe, but I've met someone else.
